Greetings! Iâ€™m here to help you with information about Dedan Kimathi University of Technology.
Goodbye! If you need more information later, come back anytime.

text: what is Dedan Kimathi University of Technology
responses: Dedan Kimathi University of Technology (DeKUT) is a premier 'Entrepreneurial University' located in Nyeri. It operates on the 'Triple Helix' model, linking government, academia, and industry[cite: 5]. [cite_start]It is home to Africa's only semiconductor factory and emphasizes 'Better Life through Technology'[cite: 6, 40].

The university started in 1972 as Kimathi Institute of Technology (KIT) through the 'Harambee' spirit. [cite_start]It was chartered as a full public university on December 14, 2012, by President Mwai Kibaki[cite: 20, 34]. [cite_start]It is named after Field Marshal Dedan Kimathi to honor the struggle for independence and liberation through education[cite: 51].

DeKUT hosts the Dedan Kimathi Science and Technology Park (DeST-Park), the first of its kind in Kenya. [cite_start]It houses Semiconductor Technologies Limited (STL), Africa's only factory manufacturing nanotechnology products and integrated circuits for the global market[cite: 6, 218].

DeKUT hosts Africa's first Siemens Training Centre, accredited by the Engineers Board of Kenya. [cite_start]It offers the globally recognized Siemens Mechatronic Systems Certification Program (SMSCP) Levels 1-3, preparing students for Industry 4.0 careers[cite: 228, 229].

DeKUT has specialized research hubs including the Centre for Data Science and AI (DSAIL) for bioacoustics and healthcare AI [cite: 237][cite_start], the Coffee Technology Center for value addition [cite: 183][cite_start], and the Centre for Biomass Energy Studies (CBES) for renewable energy[cite: 246].

text: how far is dekut from nyeri
responses: Dedan Kimathi University of Technology is located about 6 km from Nyeri town along the Nyeriâ€“Mweiga highway[cite: 4]. [cite_start]It sits on resource-rich grounds near Mt. Kenya, which supports its specialized mountaineering and tourism programs[cite: 196].

text: how can i contact the university
responses: You can reach DeKUT at 0721206030 for general inquiries. [cite_start]For specific departments or admissions, please check the DeKUT website or the departmental contact list[cite: 408].
The University generally operates Monday to Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Offices are usually closed on weekends and public holidays.

You can apply as a Government Sponsored (KUCCPS) or Self-Sponsored (SSP) student. Applications are digitized via the university portal. [cite_start]Application fees are KES 3,000 for PhD, KES 1,500 for Masters, and KES 1,000 for Undergraduate[cite: 287, 296].

Fees vary by program and sponsorship type. Payments can be made via M-PESA (Business Number 222222) or direct bank deposits. [cite_start]Always use your registration number as the account reference[cite: 308].
The DeKUT Financial Aid Office (DeFAO) manages bursaries and a Work-Study program that allows students to work part-time within the university to earn money for their upkeep[cite: 312, 313].

DeKUT has limited internal hostels (approx. 152 spaces). Most students reside in vetted external hostels like Tazama Place, Kirathimo, and Sunrise Hostel. [cite_start]Rents range from KES 2,500 to KES 10,000 per month[cite: 255, 259, 260].

Student life is vibrant with the DeKUTSO student council, professional clubs (Computer Society, Actuarial Association), and sports like the Mt. Kenya 7s Rugby Tournament. [cite_start]Unique activities include the 'Climb to Educate' mountaineering expedition[cite: 264, 270, 284].

Notable alumni include Joshua Ndemenge (Microsoft Cloud Developer Advocate), Peris Njeri Wainaina (Leather entrepreneur), and Kelvin Ngeno (Tech innovator). [cite_start]The university has also awarded honorary degrees to figures like Thabo Mbeki[cite: 326, 329, 336].

Students access course registration, fee statements and other services via the DeKUT student portal. If you need the portal link or guidance logging in, check the university website or contact ICT support.

text: what can you help me with
responses: I can provide information about DeKUT programmes, admissions, contacts, fees, department leadership and more. Ask a specific question like 'What are the engineering programmes?' or 'Who is the dean of engineering?'.

text: i don't know what to ask
responses: If you're not sure where to start, try asking about admissions, programmes, or contact details. For example: 'What courses does the School of Engineering offer?'
I was created by Cheryl Achieng as part of a DeKUT final year project.

text: tell me about the school of engineering
responses: The School of Engineering at DeKUT offers undergraduate and postgraduate programmes focused on practical engineering skills, research and industry partnerships. The school emphasizes hands-on training and applied research across multiple engineering disciplines.

text: who is the dean of engineering
who leads the school of engineering
responses: The School of Engineering is led by Dean Dr. Njenga Mburu. Departments include Chemical Engineering (HoD Dr. Kimutai Tewo), Technology Education (HoD Dr. Addero Wilson Ogot), Civil Engineering (HoD Dr. Kevin Achieng), Electrical & Electronic Engineering (HoD Dr. Edwell Tafara Mharakurwa), Mechatronic Engineering (HoD Dr. Titus Murwa Mulembo), Mechanical Engineering (HoD Dr. Mburu Ngugi).

Undergraduate programmes in the School of Engineering include: BSc Electrical & Electronic Engineering, BSc Telecommunication & Information Engineering, BSc Mechatronic Engineering, BSc Mechanical Engineering, BSc Chemical Engineering, BSc Civil Engineering, BEd Technology (Electrical & Electronic), BEd Technology (Mechanical) and BEd Technology (Civil).

Postgraduate programmes include M.Sc. in Advanced Manufacturing & Automation Engineering, Machine Tools Design & Manufacturing, Industrial Engineering & Management, Telecommunication Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, and a PhD in Mechanical Engineering. Requirements typically include a relevant BSc with an upper second-class honours or equivalent and, in some cases, relevant work experience.

Minimum entry for most engineering undergraduate programmes is a KCSE mean grade of C+ with passes in Physics, Chemistry, English and Kiswahili (or equivalent). Specific programmes may have additional subject requirements; please specify the programme for precise entry requirements.
Generally, engineering degree programmes require a KCSE mean grade of C+ and good performance in the relevant science subjects. Contact admissions for programme-specific criteria.

text: tell me about the school of computer science
responses: The School of Computer Science & Information Technology offers undergraduate and postgraduate programmes focused on software, systems and data science. The school emphasizes practical computing skills, cybersecurity, and research in modern IT disciplines.

text: who is the dean of computer science
responses: The School of Computer Science & Information Technology is led by Dean Dr. George Musumba with Dr. Kinyua Gikunda as a key departmental lead. The school includes programmes in computer science, information technology and business information technology.

text: what computer science programmes do you offer
responses: Undergraduate programmes include: BSc Computer Science, BSc Information Technology, and BSc Business Information Technology. Entry requirements vary; BSc Computer Science typically requires a C+ in Mathematics and a C+ in Physical Sciences or an equivalent combination of qualifications.
The school offers master's degrees in Computer Science, Cybersecurity and Data Science, as well as PhD opportunities for qualified candidates with a relevant master's degree.

Minimum entry varies by programme. Most computer science and IT courses require a KCSE mean grade of C+ and a C plain in Mathematics and English/Kiswahili. BSc Computer Science may require a higher performance in Mathematics and Physical Sciences.

text: tell me about the school of science
responses: The School of Science at DeKUT offers programmes in natural sciences, chemistry, physics, mathematics, statistics, actuarial science and applied sciences. The school focuses on research, laboratory-based training and strong analytical skills development.

text: who is the dean of science
responses: The School of Science is led by Dean Dr. Antony Ngunyi. Departments include Chemistry (HoD Dr. Paul Tanui), Mathematics & Physical Sciences (HoD Dr. Reuben Ndungâ€™u), and Statistics & Actuarial Science (HoD Dr. Cyprian Omari).

text: what courses are offered in school of science
responses: The school offers a variety of science degrees such as Actuarial Science, Industrial Chemistry, Leather Technology, Polymer Chemistry, Medical Physics and Mathematics & Modeling Processes.

text: postgraduate courses in school of science
responses: Postgraduate programmes include MSc in Leather Technology, MSc in Chemistry, MSc in Industrial Biochemistry, MSc in Laser & Photonic Technology, MSc in Industrial Mathematics, and a PhD in Chemistry. Admission usually requires a relevant bachelor's degree with strong academic performance.

text: how to join school of science
responses: Most science degree programmes require a KCSE mean grade of C+ with strong performance in Mathematics, English/Kiswahili and relevant science subjects. Specific requirements vary by programme.

text: tell me about the school of business
responses: The School of Business, Management & Economics offers business-oriented programmes designed to build strong analytical, managerial and entrepreneurial skills. The school combines theory, practical case studies and industry exposure.

text: who is the dean of business
responses: The School of Business, Management & Economics is led by Dean Dr. Anne Sang. The school oversees undergraduate, diploma and postgraduate programmes in business-related disciplines.
Business undergraduate options include Commerce, Business Administration and Purchasing & Supplies Management, plus diploma pathways for progression.

Postgraduate programmes include: MBA, MSc Business Analytics, MSc Supply Chain Management, MSc Project Management, MSc Economics, MSc Innovation & Entrepreneurship Management, Postgraduate Diploma in Project Management, and PhD programmes in Business Administration & Management and Operations & Supply Chain Management.

Degree programmes generally require a KCSE mean grade of C+ with good performance in Mathematics and English/Kiswahili, or a recognized KNEC diploma. Master's and PhD requirements vary based on academic background and experience.

text: tell me about the school of nursing
responses: The School of Nursing offers both direct and upgrading Bachelor of Science in Nursing programmes. The school emphasizes clinical competence, professionalism and healthcare leadership.

text: who is the dean of nursing
responses: The School of Nursing is led by Dean Dr. Florence Mbuthia.
The School of Nursing offers: Bachelor of Science in Nursing (Direct Entry) and Bachelor of Science in Nursing (Upgrading) for registered nurses. Requirements differ depending on the track.

Direct-entry BSc Nursing requires a KCSE mean grade of C+ with a C+ in Biology, English/Kiswahili, Mathematics/Physics and Chemistry. The upgrading programme requires KRCHN or KRN/KRM/PH, two years of experience and valid NCK licensing.

text: tell me about school of graduate studies
responses: The School of Graduate Studies & Research coordinates all postgraduate programmes at DeKUT. It manages admissions, academic progress, research grants, thesis examinations and overall postgraduate welfare.

text: who is the dean of graduate school
responses: The School of Graduate Studies & Research is led by Dean Dr. Douglas Onyancha.

The Institute of Criminology, Forensics and Security Studies is led by Director Mr. Dennis Miano. It offers BSc Criminology & Security Management and MSc Forensics & Security Management. Programmes align with CUE regulations and focus on applied criminology and corporate forensic management.

The Institute of Geomatics, GIS & Remote Sensing (IGGReS), led by Director Dr. Mark K. Boitt, offers BSc Geomatics Engineering & GIS, and BSc Geospatial Information Science & Remote Sensing. It also offers postgraduate programmes including MSc GIS & Remote Sensing and a PhD in Geomatics.

text: BSc Geospatial Information Science & Remote Sensing
responses: The Institute of Geomatics, GIS & Remote Sensing (IGGReS),  offers BSc Geomatics Engineering & GIS, and BSc Geospatial Information Science & Remote Sensing. It also offers postgraduate programmes including MSc GIS & Remote Sensing and a PhD in Geomatics.

KCSE applicants need a C+ in Mathematics and at least a C+ in two subjects such as Physics, Chemistry, Geography, Biology or Physical Sciences. Diploma applicants require a credit in a relevant KNEC diploma such as land surveying or geomatics.

The Institute of Tourism and Hospitality Management (IToHM), led by Director Dr. Peninah W. Chege, offers programmes in sustainable tourism and hospitality. The institute focuses on tourism operations, hospitality skills, wildlife management and sustainable tourism practices.

IToHM offers: BSc Sustainable Tourism & Hospitality Management, Diploma in Sustainable Tourism & Hospitality Management, Certificate in Institutional Accommodation & Catering Operations, and several short courses including Mountaineering & Outdoor Expeditions Guiding.

For BSc Sustainable Tourism & Hospitality Management, applicants need a C+ in KCSE or a relevant diploma. Diploma entry requires a C- with relevant subjects. Certificate courses require a minimum of D or D- depending on specialization.

The Institute of Food & Bioresources Technology (IFBT), led by Director Dr. Richard Koskei, offers programmes in Food Science & Technology, Nutrition & Dietetics, and Coffee Technology & Cupping. It focuses on food processing, nutrition, quality control and applied sciences.
IFBT provides industry-focused training in food sciences, nutrition, agro-processing and coffee technology under the leadership of Dr. Richard Koskei.

Programmes include: BSc Food Science & Technology, BSc Nutrition & Dietetics, Diploma in Coffee Technology & Cupping, Certificate in Coffee Technology, MSc Food Science & Technology, and PhD in Food Science & Technology.

Degree programmes require a KCSE mean grade of C+ with strong passes in Chemistry, Biology and Mathematics/Physics. Diplomas require at least a C- with relevant science subjects. Certificates require D+ or D depending on the course.

The Institute of Technical & Professional Studies (ITPS), led by Director Dr. Erastus Karoki, offers diplomas, certificates and professional courses across business, engineering, tourism, IT, fashion, building technology, welding and more.

ITPS offers diplomas in: Business Admin, Purchasing & Supplies Management, Information Technology, Security Management, Coffee Technology & Cupping, Food Science Technology, Tourism & Hospitality, Electrical & Electronics Engineering (Power), Fashion Design, Furniture Technology, Building Technology, Metal Work & Welding.

Certificate programmes include: Electrical & Electronics Engineering, Fashion Design, Furniture Technology, Building Technology, Welding & Design, German Language, IT, Coffee Technology, and Mountaineering & Outdoor Expeditions Guiding.
Professional courses include APS-K, CPSP-K, ATD Level I, Siemens Mechatronic Systems Certification (SMSCP Level 1), and advanced training in procurement, accounting and mechatronics.

The Geothermal Training & Research Institute (GeTRI), led by Director Dr. Patrick Chege Kariuki, offers advanced training in geothermal energy exploration, drilling, geoscience analysis and geothermal engineering.
Programmes include: MSc Geothermal Energy Technology, Postgraduate Diploma in Geothermal Energy, and BSc Geology. These programmes cover earth sciences, engineering and geothermal exploration.

MSc requirements include a relevant BSc in sciences or engineering with at least Second Class Upper or Second Class Lower with experience. BSc Geology requires a C+ in KCSE with strong grades in Mathematics and two science subjects.

text: tell me about institute of general studies
responses: The Institute of General Studies, led by Director Prof. Theuri Matthew Mwangi, oversees university-wide common units such as Communication Skills, Business English, Philosophy, Critical Thinking, Development Studies and Gender & Development.
